As Homer wandered around the store; he picked up a few things here and there and eventually found himself in the jelly bean section; looking through the section he came across the brand 'Jelly Belly' and thought to himself 'hehe I'll have one of those soon'

As he loaded up bag after bag of jelly belly beans; Homer noticed a sign on the wall saying 'you could be our winner', he walked over to it and saw leaflets below it saying

'We at Jelly Belly, love our customers and nothing makes us happier than seeing our customers happy.

We are offering a winner the chance to win a life time supply of jelly belly beans, and a chance to become the new face of jelly belly!

All you need to do is send in a photo of yourself with our brand and we'll select the winner

applicants must submit these by 30th October, post this and the photo and any other details you wish to send, address is on the back'

Homer thought; 'whoa a life time supply and a chance to become the new face! He imagined himself a lot fatter with a slogan next to him saying 'I love jelly bellies so much; I decided to become one'

Homer grabbed a another 3 bags full of the sweets and left for the cashier. As he loaded up all his sweets he had to ask 'so, this competition can be entered by anybody right? There's no limitations or anything?'

'No sir; its free entry, you got nothing to lose! And more to gain!' The young cashier said

'Oh you don't know how right you are' Homer said under his breath

'Whats that sir?' The cashier asked

'Oh nothing' Homer said 'so how much do I owe you?' Homer asked

'Well its a total of $30; but lets just call it $20, I get the feeling that we'll be seeing a lot of you' the cashier said

'Oh well, thanks!' Homer said as he handed over the 20 bucks. As he walked out of the store, he turned his head to see the young cashier looking back and smiling, then sort of fumbled with something on the counter as if to stop Homer noticing

Homer smiled and headed back to the car with a plan in mind

'Well its September 15th now; I've got a few weeks to gain some weight, then I'll send in my photo!' Homer said to himself as he downed a few of the jelly belly sweets.
152.title: The sweet shop

1521.content:
Two Weeks later and Homer was well on his way, in those two weeks he had packed himself full of all sorts of goodies and managed to stop by the circumference zone as often as he could and he'd gained 21lbs for his efforts. But somehow he didn't feel happy about it, he thought that he'd have put on weight quickly being over 300lbs before but here he was at 270lbs.

Homer headed to the circumference zone and saw that his favourite staff member was on duty

'Hey there!' Homer said walking up to the staff member

'Why if it isn't my favourite tubster; how y'all doing?' the young man asked

'Yeah...ok I guess' Homer said

'Oh; whats the matter?' The young man asked. Homer felt a bit shy but told the staff member everything, how the family was away, how he was purposely gaining weight, how he wanted to win the competition in order to get even fatter; but he just didn't feel fat enough/

'Well, thats a pretty strange predicament you got ya'self into there mister' The young man said, 'no wonder you keep coming back here, our stocks chock full o' calories' he said giving Homer's belly a gentle tap. 'but I get off in a few mins; perhaps I could be of assistance, my daddy is a pretty huge guy and I know a few tips and tricks of how to put on weight quickly' the young man said

Homer thought for a moment 'sure, that would be a great help!'

'Great, my names Mac' Mac said

'I'm Homer' Homer said, they shook hands and Mac got back to his duties for 5 minutes; whilst Homer gather lots of sweets together and paid for them.

Mac came over 5 minutes later 'right, I'm ready; where d'ya want'ta go?'
1521.title: Two Weeks later

15211.content:
Putting a finger to his chin, Homer thought quickly. "Well, I guess we can go back to my place. As I said, there is nobody around, so we'll have plenty of privacy. I mean, I don't mind being a big fatty and all but, I'd rather not have everyone staring at me... any more than they usually do."

Mac's eye's lit up slightly, a smile growing on his face. "Sounds great Homer. My car out front in the staff parking. I'll meet you outside and I'll follow you back to your place."

"Sounds fine to me Mac, I'll catch you in a while."

A couple of minutes later, the two arrive back on Evergreen Terrace. After showing Mac in, Homer drew the curtains in the dining room and showed him into the kitchen.

"Well Homer, I see you got plenty off food already in this fine house of yours. If your trying to fatten off just sweets, then I can see your problem".

"What do you mean problem, I can eat loads of candy without breaking a sweat!" Mac just shook his head.

"No no, I'm sure you can pack plenty of goodies away in that belly of your's. No, what I'm talking about is diversifying your choice of foods. Have you heard about the neglected food groups?" Homer nodded, remembering his encounter with the questionable Doctor Nick.

"You see, your mainly hitting up the empty calorie and chocotastic groups. To bulk up faster, you need to try and hit a wider range, stuff with a lot more grease and fats than sugar. Of course, that is also neglecting supplements too."

"Supplements, you mean like protein powder?"

"Kinda Homer. Though this is specifically for people wanting to get fat. Has lots of calories, and can cause even the thinnest guy to bloat up quick." Looking across at Homer, Mac got a small idea. "I just thought of something. How about I write up a rough meal plan for you. Just some ideas for each meal and every snack. Meal times, you want to focus on the fat heavy foods. Stuff like Grilled Cheese Sandwiches, Burgers, Pizza, Fondue, Greasy Meats like Bacon and Sausage."

"What about in between meals?"

"Ah you see, that's when you have your candy and chocolate. You always want something to hand that you can mindlessly snack on when watching TV, or whatever. it won't fill you up, but that's the point. You never really want to stuff yourself to the point of illness. You want to be at least sated all day, and only really at meals do you want to really fill up on all the calorie dense foods. Breads, Meats, Dairy and Sweets are your friends in this."

"Sounds good to me, guess I better get started!" Homer exclaimed, matching over too the fridge, pulling out a heap of ingredients. Setting them on the side, he turned back to Mac. "By the end of October, I'm going to be a big fat dynamo!"

"That's the spirit Homer. I'd better get going, I've got to be back on shift in 20 minutes or so. Don't worry, you've got a little over a month to submit that picture. If you can put on 20 lbs without my help, I'm sure you can easily put that much on in only a fraction of the time". With that, Mac excused himself, going out the door, heading back to his car.
15211.title: Homer's house
